sect1.title: Core BEEN Services
sect1.para: BEEN includes several services of key importance. This section lists these core services and instructs user where to find more information about them.

sect2.title: Software Repository
sect2.para: Software Repository is a component that stores BEEN packages containing tasks, pluggable modules and possibly also other types of packages. It has an interface through which these packages can be searched for, uploaded and downloaded.
Software Repository can be started from "Services" tab of WebUI and controlled from "Software Repository" tab.
More information about Software Repository you can find in Development Documentation,

sect2.title: Host Manager
sect2.para: This section has been copied from .

The Host Manager is responsible for maintaining an up-to-date list of all hosts in the benchmarking environment and maintains database which stores data about hardware and software configuration of each host.

The Host Manager is also responsible for monitoring availability and utilization of hosts in the environment. It provides tools to generate basic statistics about the utilization of a specific host over time.

sect2.title: Debug Assistant
sect2.para: Debug Assistant is a service that simplifies debugging of tasks run by BEEN. It can be started from "Services" tab of WebUI and controlled from "Debug Assistant" tab.
More information about debugging BEEN and tasks run by it you can find in .

sect2.title: Results Repository
sect2.para: The Results Repository service can be started from "Services" tab of WebUI.
Detailed information about how to use Results Repository can be found in Development Documentation, and User Documentation, .

sect2.title: Benchmark Manager
sect2.para: The Benchmark Manager service can be started from "Services" tab of WebUI.
Detailed information about how to use Benchmark Manager can be found in Development Documentation, and User Documentation, .

sect2.title: Command Line Interface
sect2.para: The Command Line Interface service can be started from "Services" tab of WebUI.
Detailed information about how to use Command Line Interface can be found in Development Documentation, and User Documentation, .
